text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
author: Thoreau

text: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: What's in a name? That which we call a rose, by any other name would smell as sweet.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Every man sacrifices himself for his ambition. To gain glories, and to lose dreams, those are the fates one can scarcely avoid.
author: Kentaro Miura

text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: If I fear anything then I fear that I'll grow an old man full of regrets for what could have been. It's good that I'm young and aware of this.
Don't try to be a great man, just be a man. And let history make its own judgements.
author: Zefram Cochrane

text: Let one live alone doing no evil, care-free, like an elephant in the elephant forest.
author: Nagavagga: The elephant

text: Living our lives so many things we've feared. And we shouldn't have -- we should have lived.
author: Ivo Andrić

text: Don't let yourself be blinded by fear or anger. Everything is only as it is.
author: Yuki Urushibara

text: The brighter that any light shines, the darker the nearby shadows grow.
author: Kentaro Miura

text: One instant is eternity; eternity is now. When you see through this one instant, you see through the ones who sees.
author: Wu Men

text: Courage is not always rewarded. Nevertheless, remain courageous.
author: Albion

text: The best things in life you get for free. You just need to recognize them being offered and take them.
True courage is not the absence of fear -- but the willingness to proceed in spite of it.
author: Anonymous

text: Unconditional love is something you can't fight to earn. You either get it for free, or you don't get it at all. But you can fight to keep it.
Freedom is the gift of having the opportunity to impose discipline on yourself, rather than having others impose it on you.
He who fights monsters should see to it that he does not become a monster himself. If you gaze long into the abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: If there's only one thing that you're capable of, try to master that one thing.
author: Fate/Stay Night

text: Poets in love aren't telling the truth as poets, but as those in love they remain forever incapable of expressing everything they feel.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Everybody has a different perspective. Don't think everybody sees things in the same way you do.
author: Senka Sedmak

text: The reward lies in the struggle, not in the prize.
author: Data

text: Never argue with a fool. Somebody watching might not be able to tell the difference.
Remember! Sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: The best friends in life are those you can spend an evening with not saying a word, and leave feeling it was the best talk of your life.
Love takes away the sharpness of spirit from those that have it, and gives it to those that don't.
author: Denis Diderot

text: La chance, c’est comme le Tour de France. On l’attend longtemps et ça passe vite. Quand le moment vient, faut sauter la barrière sans hésiter.
author: Dufayel

text: We do not stop playing because we grow old, we grow old because we stop playing.
The mind is like the sky. Layers of clouds obscure its true nature.
author: Tibetian saying

text: No room is empty if your mind is full, and no room is full if your mind is empty.
author: Lama Norbu

text: Even the journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows does not speak, he who speaks does not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows others is wise, he who knows himself is enlightened.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: Wherever you go, go with your heart.
author: Confucius

text: The principles of an idealist who does not abide them are worthless.
author: Salvatore

text: Greater, indeed, are pleasures that are shared.
author: Salvatore

text: Hell is heaven watched from the other side.
author: Umberto Ecco

text: Keep going, even though you have nowhere to arrive.
author: Rumi

text: Love deeply and passionately. Although this can hurt you, it is the only way to live your life completely.
author: Nepalese mantra

text: Speak slowly, think quickly.
author: Nepalese mantra

text: Never explain yourself. Those who like you don't need it, and those who dislike you won't believe it.
Death can come at any time -- relax.
author: Zen koan

text: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.
author: William Wallace

text: From little sleep and too much reading his brain dried up and he lost his wits.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

text: We are what we believe we are.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them.
author: Thoreau

text: This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
author: Alan W. Watts

text: It's easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.
author: Grace Hopper

text: This world is cruel... and at the same time very beautiful.
author: Attack on Titan

text: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are so certain of themselves and wiser people so full of doubts..
author: Bertrand Russell

text: The secret of success is to understand the viewpoint of others.
author: Henry Ford

text: Find what you love and let it kill you.
author: Charles Bukowski
